com.facebook.buck.rules.keys

Class RuleKeyBuilder<RULE_KEY>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.facebook.buck.rules.keys.RuleKeyBuilder<RULE_KEY>
  • Type Parameters:
    RULE_KEY - - the actual type that the builder produces (e.g. HashCode).
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    RuleKeyObjectSink
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ContentAgnosticRuleKeyFactory.Builder, DefaultRuleKeyFactory.Builder

    public abstract class RuleKeyBuilder<RULE_KEY>
extends Object
implements RuleKeyObjectSink
    A base implementation for rule key builders. RuleKeyFactory classes create concrete instances of this class and use them to produce rule keys. Concrete implementations may tweak behavior of the builder, and at the very minimum should implement setAppendableRuleKey(RuleKeyAppendable), and setBuildRule(BuildRule). This class implements RuleKeyObjectSink interface which is the primary mechanism of how RuleKeyFactory and RuleKeyAppendable classes feed the builder. Each element fed to the builder is a (key, value) pair. Keys are always simple strings, typically the name of a field annotated with AddToRuleKey. Values on the other hand may be complex types that are resolved recursively. For instance, a list of elements gets serialized by serializing each element of the list in order, and finally serializing the list token along with the length of the list. Similarly for other containers and wrappers. There is an exception to the above rule of how containers and wrappers get serialized. Namely, they only get serialized if at least one of their elements gets serialized. This is to support concrete rule key builders that ignore some elements, or handle them differently. For example, several concrete builders handle SourcePath elements in a special way.

      • setSourcePath

        protected abstract RuleKeyBuilder<RULE_KEY> setSourcePath(SourcePath sourcePath)
                                                   throws IOException
        Implementations may just forward to setSourcePathDirectly(com.facebook.buck.rules.SourcePath). However, they will typically want to handle BuildTargetSourcePath explicitly. See also setSourcePathAsRule(com.facebook.buck.rules.BuildTargetSourcePath<?>).
        Throws:
        IOException

      • setSourcePathDirectly

        protected final RuleKeyBuilder<RULE_KEY> setSourcePathDirectly(SourcePath sourcePath)
                                                        throws IOException
        To be called from setSourcePath(SourcePath). Note that this implementation handles BuildTargetSourcePath same as a PathSourcePath pointing to the output of that target. Implementations may change this behavior by handling BuildTargetSourcePath explicitly in setSourcePath(SourcePath) instead of calling this method. See also setSourcePathAsRule(com.facebook.buck.rules.BuildTargetSourcePath<?>).
        Throws:
        IOException

      • setSourcePathAsRule

        protected final RuleKeyBuilder<RULE_KEY> setSourcePathAsRule(BuildTargetSourcePath<?> sourcePath)
        To be called from setSourcePath(SourcePath) in case BuildTargetSourcePath should be handled as a build rule. This method hashes the given BuildTargetSourcePath and invokes setBuildRule(BuildRule) on the associated rule.
